column4: How do I disable compiz in Ubuntu 11.10? And how would I re-enable it if I wanted to?
Assuming you want to continue using unity, you would log out, select "Unity 2D" at the login screen, and log back in. Select just "Unity" again to go back to compiz.
Is that the only way?
No. Why?
Why do you want to disable compiz in the first place?
I want to diable compiz because everything seems to be running slow, and TeamSpeak is crashing - someone said to try disabling compiz.
OK. What is wrong with the method I suggested?
nothing
I was just wondering if there was a better way because I have a lot of things open right now.
Teamspeak is available in the repositories.
sudo apt-get install teamspeak-client
I'm not sure that is the correct version.
I downloaded Teamspeak 3 from their website, but when I look in repositories, it says 2.0.32
What is the full path to the file, including the full file name?
/home/mike/Downloads/TeamSpeak3-Client-linux_x86-3.0.1.run
Then run "chmod +x /home/mike/Downloads/TeamSpeak3-Client-linux_x86-3.0.1.run && /home/mike/Downloads/TeamSpeak3-Client-linux_x86-3.0.1.run"
Ok, do I need sudo?
No.
Ok, seems like it worked - thank you for the help. I might need more help in a little while, who knows. :)
You're welcome.
Quick question. It says this in Terminal: Creating directory TeamSpeak3-Client-linux_x86   - How do I find this directory?
nvm I actually just found it
